entities.name: Society
entities.description: Society refers to a group of individuals living together in an organized manner.

entities.name: Information Processing
entities.description: The process of collecting, organizing, and manipulating data to produce meaningful information.

entities.name: Urban Landscapes
entities.description: Urban landscapes were transformed by the widespread adoption of electric lighting.

entities.name: THOMAS EDISON
entities.description: American inventor and businessman who developed many devices that greatly influenced life around the world, including the phonograph, the motion picture camera, and the long-lasting, practical electric light bulb

entities.name: social media
entities.description: Social media are interactive web-based platforms that allow users to create, share, and exchange information, ideas, and other forms of expression over the internet.

entities.name: Modern Transportation Systems
entities.description: Modern transportation systems include various modes of transport such as cars, trains, and airplanes.

entities.name: Entertainment
entities.description: Entertainment is a form of activity that holds the attention and interest of an audience, or gives pleasure and delight.

entities.name: INDUSTRIAL REVOLUTION
entities.description: A period of significant industrial and technological change.

entities.name: Business
entities.description: Business involves commercial and financial activities aimed at generating profit.

entities.name: 3500 BC
entities.description: A significant period in human history, around which the wheel was invented.

entities.name: Transportation
entities.description: Transportation is a sector that involves the movement of people and goods from one place to another.

entities.name: Communication
entities.description: Communication involves the exchange of information between individuals.

entities.name: Work and Interaction
entities.description: The ways in which people work and interact with the world.

entities.name: PRINTING PRESS
entities.description: The printing press, invented by Johannes Gutenberg in the 15th century, revolutionized the dissemination of information, making books and other printed materials more accessible to the general population. It played a crucial role in the spread of knowledge and the democratization of information

entities.name: COMPUTER
entities.description: The computer, with the first electronic digital computer, ENIAC, developed in the 1940s, has revolutionized virtually every aspect of our lives, from business and education to entertainment and communication. It has enabled us to process vast amounts of information quickly and efficiently, transforming the way we work and interact with the world

entities.name: Information Access
entities.description: Information access involves the ability to obtain and use information.

entities.name: MESOPOTAMIA
entities.description: Ancient region where the wheel was invented, located in the area of the Tigris-Euphrates river system, corresponding to modern-day Iraq, Kuwait, and parts of Syria and Turkey

entities.name: E-commerce
entities.description: E-commerce involves buying and selling goods or services over the internet.

entities.name: Famous Inventions
entities.description: A collection of significant inventions that have had a profound impact on human civilization.

entities.name: ALEXANDER GRAHAM BELL
entities.description: Scottish-born American inventor, scientist, and engineer who is credited with inventing and patenting the first practical telephone

entities.name: 19th century
entities.description: The 19th century spans from the year 1801 to 1900. It was a period of significant technological and social change, including the Industrial Revolution"s continuation and the advent of new inventions such as the telephone and the light bulb.

entities.name: Literacy
entities.description: Literacy is the ability to read and write. It is essential for personal development and societal progress.

entities.name: Global Economy
entities.description: The global economy encompasses all economic activities and interactions on a worldwide scale.

entities.name: Electric Lighting
entities.description: Electric lighting is a technology that provides artificial light through the use of electrical power.

entities.name: 20th century
entities.description: The 20th century spans from the year 1901 to 2000 and is marked by significant technological advancements, social changes, and global events.

entities.name: Candles
entities.description: Candles were a common form of artificial lighting before the invention of the light bulb.

entities.name: Education
entities.description: Education is the process of facilitating learning, or the acquisition of knowledge, skills, values, beliefs, and habits.

entities.name: Business Practices
entities.description: Business practices refer to the methods and procedures used by organizations to conduct their operations.

entities.name: goods
entities.description: Goods are items that can be transported and traded, often for commercial purposes.

entities.name: 18th century
entities.description: The 18th century, also known as the Age of Enlightenment, was a period marked by significant advancements in science, technology, and philosophy.

entities.name: Modern Industrial Society
entities.description: Modern industrial society is characterized by advanced manufacturing processes, mechanization of industries, and mass production of goods.

entities.name: JOHANNES GUTENBERG
entities.description: German blacksmith, goldsmith, printer, and publisher who introduced movable type printing to Europe. His invention of the printing press in the 15th century revolutionized the dissemination of information

entities.name: Mobile Communication Technologies
entities.description: Mobile communication technologies include various methods and devices used to communicate wirelessly over long distances, such as mobile phones and satellite phones.

entities.name: Manufacturing Processes
entities.description: Manufacturing processes involve the creation of goods through various stages, from raw materials to finished products.

entities.name: Future Generations
entities.description: Future generations have been inspired by the ingenuity and creativity demonstrated through inventions like the light bulb.

entities.name: books
entities.description: Books are printed or digital works that contain written or illustrated content and are usually bound together. They serve as a medium for the dissemination of information, knowledge, and entertainment.

attributes.Purpose: Dissemination of Information, Knowledge, and Entertainment

entities.name: general population
entities.description: The general population refers to the broad mass of people in a society, including all demographics and socioeconomic groups.

attributes.Accessibility to Information: Improved due to the printing press

entities.name: Consumer Behavior
entities.description: Consumer behavior refers to the actions and decisions made by consumers in the process of purchasing goods and services.

entities.name: Human Lives
entities.description: Human lives encompass all aspects of human existence, including personal, social, and professional activities.

entities.name: Global Collaboration
entities.description: Global collaboration involves working together with people from different parts of the world.

entities.name: 15th century
entities.description: The 15th century spans from the year 1401 to 1500. It was a period marked by significant inventions and cultural developments, including the invention of the printing press.

entities.name: Literacy and Spread of Ideas
entities.description: The spread of knowledge and literacy has been significantly influenced by technological advancements.

entities.name: knowledge
entities.description: Knowledge refers to the information, understanding, and skills acquired through education or experience. It plays a crucial role in human development and societal progress.

attributes.Impact on Society: Transforms the way we live, work, and communicate
attributes.Spread Mechanism: Through inventions like the computer and the internet

entities.name: Various Aspects of Life
entities.description: Different areas of human activity, including business, education, entertainment, and communication.

entities.name: Democratization of Information
entities.description: The democratization of information refers to the process where access to information is made available to a broader audience, often leading to increased participation and engagement in various aspects of society.

entities.name: 1940s
entities.description: The 1940s was a decade that saw significant technological advancements, particularly in the field of computing.
